tagline: Game for Linux terminals (and maybe for something else)
body:
FREG is a free-roaming elementary game.
Inspired by Minecraft and Angband.

Development stage: implementing basics.

Language: C++
Non-standard libraries: ncurses, pthreads

Compile:
g++  -lncurses -pthread main.cpp

Development is run on GNU/Linux, but on MS Windows should work too with [PDCurses](http://pdcurses.sourceforge.net/) and [Pthreads-w32](http://sources.redhat.com/pthreads-win32/).

Now only singleplayer is developed, multiplayer is planned.

Screenshots of early versions are available [here](https://picasaweb.google.com/mmaulwurff/Eyecube?authuser=0&feat=directlink).

Some description is available [here](http://my.opera.com/mmaulwurff/search/?search=FREG) [russian].
Also there is a [Google+ page](https://plus.google.com/112719899034359702406).

Advices are welcome.

Copyright (C) 2011 Alexander Kromm (mmaulwurff@gmail.com)
